text: Draft. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of brett, malt, caramel, and wood. The flavor og lemons, hops, brett, and straw, leading to a tart finish.

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dry, oranges and bretty. Wooden. Mild earthy. Minerals. Dry, wooden and slight citric. Lingering herbal. Dry and herbal. Mild citric and fuity finish.

At the whales tasting at Toms. Hazy amber-gold with a dissolving foamy white head. Baby barf, young wood in the nose, very sour and earthy and barf-like taste, that mellows down in further sipping. Light-to-medium body, mild sour finish and quite carbonated.

Bottle shared at crazy high alcoholic beers tasting. Slight hazy copper golden with short lasting big fluffy head. Sweet grapes, light sulphur, lemon, green apple, light funk. Quite some hay and grass, light straw even! Some malts, and a touch of pee. Flintstones! Lots of typical Boon hay and herbs with quite some flintstones, but also lots of nice fruits. Medium sour and light sweet. Medium bodied with not that much carbonation even though it was very lively while pouring. Nice gueuze.

At home, bottle thanks to Maakun the lambiekstoemper :-p. Hazy golden with white head. Sweet grain, hay, grapes, grapestone, grassy, woody, flints, the toilet of De Paas. Light sweet and moderate sour. Medium body, soft carbonation, minerallike feel. Lekker hoor!

Bottle sample at "whales" tasting, thanks DSG. Hazy yellow golden with a big creamy head. Aroma is funky, oak, green leaves, herbs, wine. Medium sour, lactic, fruity, wood, berries, green apples. Light-bodied, dry but smooth. Very good.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Hazy golden. Great funky aroma with cobwebs, barnyard, fruitiness, cellar, sweat, oak. Tart flavor, funky, with barnyard, lots of oak, citrus, light bitterish note. Medium-bodied. Great, quite delicate.

Huge funky aroma, sulfuric notes, ascorbic acid notes. Some berries hints. Quite bitter, wooden flavor. Reminds of sea buckthorn. Sourish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At the whale tasting, Toms Place, Pours golden with a nice head, aroma of sulfur, floral tones, lavender, horse blanket, fresh, flavor is slightly sour, sulfur, lavender, tea, bitter tones, medium bodied, very nice

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Cuvee Lambikstoemper ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy barnyard, leather, farmyard, apple - grapes, sulfur. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, dry, funky, farmyard, sweet fruit - grappes - apple, tart, oak - wood. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160624]

750 ml bottle at Gueuze tasting 2016, Ulfborg. Unclear golden color with off white head. Yeasty aroma, funky bretty, dusty, barnyard, grassy, citrusy fruity, wood. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

From Bottle @fonefan gueuze tasting Ulfborg, thanks to Bursprak - june 24th 2016. Pours a cloudy orangy golden with a small, white head. Aroma has sick funk, leather, oak, vinegar, moldy, slight cheesy, vanilla, more funk. Taste is tart, vinegary, sour, dry. Oily, but with a rather high carbonation which makes it pretty fluffy.

Gylden uklar skum hvid 
Citrus eddike stald svovl
Bitter modrate sur lidt
Sur lidt 
@f1

Bottle @ Ulfborg Gueuze Tasting thanks to Bursprak. Pours bright hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of heavy funk, citrus, stone fruits, horseblanket. Taste is funky, peachy, light vinegary, citrussy.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 240616
Bottle @ Ulfborg gueze tasting. Cloudy orangish pour with a small head. Tons of funk, cheese, mushrooms, light sweet notes, minerals, some stone fruit and light tart.

Bottle @ Gueuze tasting 2016 ulfborg. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of funk, barn, sesam, citrus, woody, fruity. Taste is rahter sour, loads of barn, light leather, good funk, gooseberries. Rather dry with loads of barn, a tad too much sesam.

750mL bottle, pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out loads of barnyard funk, lots of wood, and horse blanket. Flavour is full of wood, barnyard funk, horse blanket, and leather. Very complex, with a lovely woodiness that lingers. Fantastic stuff.

Bouteille 75cl partagée avec Tomaz BB 29.03.2033.
Orangée présentant un léger trouble, col blanc-cassé crémeux et onctueux.
Arôme offre un nez fruité, lambic avec impression de cave et chêne boisé en rétro. Le tout demeure fort plaisant.
Palais est sur effervescence moyenne voire haute, sécheresse perdurante en find e bouche, finement boisé avec un fruité tirant sur les agrumes, petit douceur résiduelle.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 750ml bottle. Funky aroma, barnyard, dank straw. Deep flavor, just a touch of sweet malt, not much, big wilds. Medium bodied with high carbs. Pretty good, only above average for a gueuze.
Hazy yellow with a white head. Funky, sour, musky basement, gym socks, somewhat cheesy.

A shared bottle at dutch trading co last night..memory says
Looks.. Cloudy orange..(with my top up getting some of the bottom of the bottle) med-lge head.
Smells .. Old socks and that barnyard thing, a little citrus
Tastes .. Lemon & unripe apple acidity, a little orange citrus/tangy apricot.
Was one of the highlights amongst 12 lambicbeer shared.

75cl bottle doing its rounds at Zwanze 2015, Moeder Lambic, merci. - Smells and tastes quite young still, fluffy and pillowy, yet effervescent in mouthfeel, juicy with the sap of young, unripe lemons, some sulphur and young hay grasses, balancing out the white almond wheat. Musty like wet young wood and apple peel compost. Never would have told this has over 6%, nor that its all Boon lambiek here. Will revisit VAT77 soon.

Bottle shared at The Cads 10 year get together. 29/03/2015. Thank to MannyGoldberg. Hazed golden orange coloured pour with a loose white head. Aroma is horsey,sour, rubber, little onion, chive. Some petrol on the nose. Flavour is composed of sour tangy orange, onion, funky, citrus, musty. Palate is airy carbonation, musty, dryin finish.
Thank Jazz, very nice here, tart, funky, moderate sweetness, finish is horse and barnyard. Some trash and vinegar in there but nice trash. Not rotten food trash.

750mL bottle, I assume one and only Batch #1, bottled March 2013, drunk 7/24/15. Big thanks to Adam for sharing this rare lambic!Good pour with a moderate amount of white head that slowly recedes to cover. Deep peachy-gold body is well-carbonated, and shows a great clarity, leaving sediment behind.What a nose!!! Holy Cantillon! All of the barrels that went in to this beer are Boon-based lambic, assumedly, but it smells so similar to Cantillon that I would almost definitely tend to identify it as such, blindly. Huge sourness, cheesy lactic notes, burnt rubber, sulfur and a big woodiness. Not the lighter, more tart and fruity brett-heavy notes of something like 3F or Hanssens. Wonderfully strong, lasting aroma and I sniffed it for a good five minutes before trying my first sip. Maybe not quite the complexity of the best Cantillon guezes Ive had, but right up there, nonetheless. No alcohol noted, no flaws.The flavor is heavily acidic, heavily dry with intense woodiness (heavily tannic, very dry) and, unfortunately, a bit of near-acetone-like bitter astringency on the end. This throws off the balance and the alcohol, as Ive found it to do in lambics, loosens the body, exacerbating this heavy acidity/bitterness. Other than that, its still full of interesting and funky lambic flavors; lemons, cheese, barnyard, band-aids and so forth. Just not quite making good on what the aroma seemed to promise. Carbonation levels are appropriate, texture is slick-to-watery and there are no off-flavors (other than the intense tannin and acetone-like notes). Very interesting and wont soon forget the nose on this thing. Thanks, Adam!

Acquired in person in Belgium, Nice to finally rate this one!

A - Sat sideways but a little disturbed so its cloudy, dark orange, 1 finger head.

S - The aroma is freaking perfect. like cheesy, lemon, lime, egg, wheat, grass, oak, everything 3F lambic in aroma.

T - Good explosion of mouthfeel at first then thins out to a watery finish. Taste is pretty good. Not a ton of taste here. sure, lemon, lime, grassy and wheat. Very clean. this is going to improve greatly with time!

M - Very light, watery, starts great but goes thin.

O - now its a very weak offering. Will re-rate in a few years and I hope the taste improves.

Bottle: Thanks, Adam! Cloudy amber-orange, nearly opaque with a soft, fluffy white head. Aroma is reminiscent of Drie Fonteinen gueuze. Huge woody funk, sweat, mildewy cork, orange, lemon rind, white wine grapes, a touch of barnyard. Flavor is lovely; huge barnyard stall funk. Wood, horsey funk, sweaty feet, really dry driftwood in the finish. Awesome stuff.
Bottle. Pours hazed golden orange with a white head. Funky yeasty base, some light citric notes, and mild fruity tartness. Good stuff.

Bottle courtesy of James B. at the Half Marathon tasting, May 16th 2015. Pours a bright golden body with light haze and frothy white lacing. Aroma is cheesy, oaky gueuze, funky fruit - lemons and sour peach skins. Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, dry, with notes of oak, minerals, funky lemon, dry fruit skins, aged cheese and funky yeast. Nice gueuze.

Bottle @ The Cads 10yr Shindig. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity funky sour tart aroma. Fruity sour tart funky weak citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky woody finish.

Bottle split at Bruces pad - for the last time, big thanks to Manny G, 27/03/15.
Hazed orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is bitter lemon, smoked straw, dank notes, touch cheesey, bitter citric rinds, funky qualities, earthy.
Taste comprises light sweat, bitter lemon, apple core, spice, damp hay, woody must.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Solid gueuze.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 75cl bottle shared at The Cads 10yr anniversary at CBC Clerkenwell, London. It pours a slightly hazed golden golor with a large white head. Aroma is citric, acidic, fruity, sweet, lightly funky. Taste is medium sweet and medium tart and acidic, with notes of funk, lemon pell, hay. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice lambic although a bit young.

[ bottle ][ 1oz ][ @DC tasting ][ ? ][ mini tumbler ][ 02.15.15 ]hazy gold hay, puffy dense small white head. Sharp acidity, bright with considerable bitterness. Thin front palate, leathery with heavy citrus, bright bitter front with ultra short finish, cleaning product and thin with faint carbonation.

Bottle shared at The Cads 10th Ratebeer Anniversary. Orange in colour, little murky, cloudy. Nose is funky, rustic burnt rubber that lambic can have, massive funk, tangy, horse blanket, cheese rind. Bold and tangy gueuze, little seltzer carbonation. Touch watery, but very good.
Bottle at Toms 10 yr anniversary. Cloudy gold orange lasting white head. Toast wood sourness. Completely drinkable. Some sweetness. So good.

27th March 2015Swan Song at Bruces. Thanks to MannyG. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Airy palate, mild fine carbonation. Mild gueuzy wet wood. Bitter dried fruits. Mild brett. Light finish. Quite a mellow one. Tasty and easy drinking.

Bottle share, thanks to Padraig! Hazy yellow, sparkling, small bubbly head dissipates quickly. Aroma is tangerine, lemon, dried apricot and dried pineapple, acidic. Body is medium, foamy, tingly carbonation. Taste is dry, papery, lemon and grapefruit, mellow tartness, orange pith. Nice.

Bottle thanks to Manny G. It pours hazy golden-orange with a thick white head. The nose is earthy, funky, manure, vanilla, spoiled peach, sweaty sock The taste is smooth, funky, mellow, earth, light lactic, hay, wood, light sherbet and floral with a dry, woody finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Quite soft and smooth. Easy going. Doesnt wow me, but very drinkable anyhow.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Padraig. Pours unclear gold with a creamy white head. Good grassy hop aroma, some ripe lemon, hints of rind, some dank basement. Light to medium sweet flavor with nips of juicy citrus, slight grass, hay, orange, lemon rind. Light bodied with lively, massaging carbonation. Fairly clean on the finish, but still musty and dank, some damp hay, ripe lemon, bitter grass and rind. Quite nice.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 Color: Pours a fiery orange with a 2-finger off-white head.

Aroma: Bursting with funky smells! Strong smell of an old damp basement. Light bleu cheese funk. Touch of earthiness and oak. I get mushrooms. So many wonderful things going on here. One of the best gueuze aromas.

Taste/Mouthfeel: Very lightly carbed despite what I initially perceived. It is very close to being flat. A moderate, yet soft burst of that funky aroma comes out in the taste. Disappears very quickly. Its very delicate and soft on the palate unlike any other gueuze Ive ever tasted. Tastes like someone bottled up some funky basement mold. Thats the best way I can describe it. The finish is quick, but leaves me wanting more and more.

Overall: This is something special. The flavors are so refined, soft, and yet unlike any gueuze/lambic Ive ever had before.

Bottle at James for a tasting with Ferris and Kraddel. Pours a hazed amber orange with a thin white head. Big dirty musk and funk on the nose, earthy and filthy cheese. Earthy with a touch of sweetness, fruity with cherry. Long musky finish with tart acid and dirty brett.
Good grapefruit bretta in this. Tart finish, and good balance. Nice. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Bottle shared by Kraddel.
Bottle at Brony Tasting, DC. Brown malt. Hazy head. Tart sharp orange-citrus aroma. Body is more brown malt and flat, mild yeast. Flavor is same as aroma and up front. Mild finish. OK
Bottle at the DC Tasting. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, citrus, hay. Tastes of citrus, peach, lemon. Medium body with a dry finish.
Bottle @ Travlrs. deep gold with a small head. Pollen and dank attic. So musty. White grape and lemon. Old towels (seriously). Taste is musty. Lemon, earthy. Quite funky. Rustic. Lovely stuff.

Bottle courtesy of kraddel, the Brony King himself, thank you sir! Hazy to cloudy golden yellow color, big white head. Nice aroma of dusty feet, belly button and rotten fruit. Taste is funky, dusty, sweaty and earthy overripe fruit. Very nice.
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of woody, lemon and funky Belgian yeast. Medium body.
Bottle. Golden pour with tan head. Smells like fantastic gueze aromas. Flavors are close to drie Fonteinen nice Gueze . Well Done.

75cl bottle, aged somewhat 2 years. Dry peppery aroma, oak, esters, hop and some traces of the distinctive VATs from Boon... some sweetness in the nose on the end. Round tastes of barnyard, oak, medium sour, lemon peel, dry finish and the sweet character doesnt linger on, which is real nice. Love the wood aroma and taste intertwining wonderfully. A tad too sweet on the second glass though. Remedy, eat some Brussels keis and fresh mandekeskaas with it. Delish!
Corked bottle. Golden color. Oak, grapes, bitter walnuts and a hint of citrus in the aroma. Sour, somewhat herbal bitter flavor, nutty with oak and lemon. Dry. Complex. Enjoyable.

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: sour, barnyard, apples.
TASTE: sour, barnyard, apples, dry, very nice geuze!

Geuze made by Boon for the 15 years existence of beer club De Lambikstoempers. Stable, snow white, lacing, dense head, colour hazy deep golden blonde with a bit of a greenish hue. Complex and funky aroma as expected from the style, lemon, lime juice, unripe green plums, red apple, woody accent, white vinegar, dry sherry, something sulphuric. Soft (malse) taste, very estery, fruit acidity, sharp and champenoise carbonation, minerally, very yeasty with a long, dry, tart and woody finish with a vague hint of leafy hops. Complex and appealing enough but not the most characterful geuze I had. Not quite worth the money, Im afraid - Id prefer Boons own Geuze Mariage Parfait well over this.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong feet, rubber, funk. Medium mouth with nice funk, oak, light dryness. Very good.

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks bro! pours cloudy, almost murky, golden orange with a very nice white head, bubbly and strong, leaving good lacing. spicy and peppery apricots, funk-eh, minty and woodsy if not woody, complex acidity - lactic, citric and gently acetic, tasty wheat, unsweetened floral honey if at all possible, grass and bitter herbs. bright carbonation, light body - oily, never sweet or too heavy or boozy, ending dry, tart and tannic-woodsy-grassy-herbal finish. superb body and mouthfeel. solid gueuze!

Bottle 750ml.
Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma is extremely barnyardy, with funk, horseback riding stuff, leather on leather. Taste is of citrus, funk, some metal. Palate: Light body. Medium carbonation. Dry. Overall: Very nice funk in there. Outstanding beer.

Bottle shared by tom10101, thanks a lot Tom! Pours a not so clear golden with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is that of a classic gueuze: hay, sour fruits, barnyard. Taste is lemony and dry, moderately tart. Body is medium, carbonation really high and festive, champagne-like. A really nice gueuze!

75cl, at 7%Vol, new exclusive brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Pieter for bringing this over!, complex sour brew, woody/sour and slightly fruity/floral/bitter, balanced, cloudy, good head, good brew, yet expensive
bottle sample. poured a cloudy amber golden colour with a big white head. barnyard, sour apple, citrus, oak, lemons, tart, nice sour, dry, yeast, big carbonation, acid, pretty nice

Bottle, 11/16/2014. Hazy, dull copper pour with thick white frothy head, nice retention, sticky soapy lacing. Aroma is musty, damp barnyard, apricot and leather, lemon and wood. Taste is funky fruit, apricot and peach, moderately tart, soured cereal grains with lemon overtones, some lingering wood and subtle vanilla in the aftertaste. Light body, soft carbonation makes this a nice drinker. Good geuze.

Bottle @ Hotel. Cloudy golden-orange pour with white foam. Super funky nose. A lot of leather, mushroom, and damp earth. Green apple, lemon peel, and yeast. Nice citrus zest and some pear. Flavor has a ton of dusty, leathery funk to it. A lot of mushroom and damp wood. Nice acidity to this. Plenty of lemon and tart orange zest. Nicely done.

20/X/14 - 75cl bottle @ home - BB: 29/III/33 (2014-1234) Thanks to BelgBeerGeek for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy beige beer, very big soapy foam head, white, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very pleasant lambic smell, woody, bit fruity, lemon peel. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: lemony, soft bitterness, pretty sour, subtle brett notes, dry, lemon peel. Aftertaste: sour, fruity, hint of banana, oranges, lemon juice, slightly bitter, woody touch, nice and tangy. Lovely stuff!

Bottle brought by Todd. Thanks! 

A: Cloudy orange-gold, white head, lacing.

N: Grapefruit, lemon zest, acid, touch of butter, brett, spent grains, peppercorn, and oak.

T: Nicely tart. Very light sweetness. 

M: Light body, no alcohol, carbonation is prickly.

O: A nice, if young-tasting Gueuze. Reminds me of Beatification a little bit, if not as mature.

Bottle shared at a Portland tasting 
Cloudy golden with a big white head, some lacing. Aroma is citrus, cheesy and barnyard. Taste is tart, fruity and cheese  
Good

750 ml bottle thanks to Todd! Pours a bright orange color with a big white head. A funky woody lemon nose. The flavor is sharp, light cheese, dusty, lemons, oranges, brett, woody tannins. Very flavorful and tasty. Finishes a bit sweet and zingy. Very nice.

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast acid citrus. The flavour is acid lemon citrus with a similarl palate. Light bodied witn lively carbonation. Super refreshing. A great beer.

Sample courtesy of and shared with Kermis
Thin white head. Cloudy light amber pour. Pretty decent. Slight sourness.

Bottle shared. Pours very hazy Amber with an off white head. Aroma  has loads of tart fruits, citrus, funk, cobwebs, wood and dank cellar. Flavour is over moderate acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Botte (750 ml). From 77ships or JulienHuxley who both sent me some bottles, thanks! Hazy golden with a nice persistent white head and some lacing. Aroma is really nice even though its quite soft... theres peaches/apricots, mild funk, hay, herbal presence and light wood notes. Taste is a little less fruity, but the peaches/apricots are still present along a little more funk than in the aroma, wood and grass. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Dry finish. Very smooth gueuze. Really tasty. Heavily drinkable, especially for the abv. Quite complex and good depth. I think it will age well.

Bottle, opened with a nice pop. Glowing hazy gold pour with nice persistent white head. Aroma is really fruity, so much peach/apricot, nice mellow funk, light dank grassy notes, old hay. Taste is super fruity as well, really juicy apricot flavor, mild tartness, light lemony citrusy acidity, very mild funk, very light and fresh, super easy drinking. Palate is light bodied with soft carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Bottle shared at Borefts. Clear orange with a white head. Aroma is orange peel, funk, white wine, dried apricot. Light bodied, tart on the palate with a hint of citrus and a dry finish. Taste is dried apricots, citrus peel, orange juice, funk.

Bottle, generously shared by Seth at Zwanze Day. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Funk and barnyard bouquet. All kinds of funk, barnyard, and wet blanket notes. Spice and woody lowlights. Complex. Above average body and mouthfeel.

#3700. 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Streekbierweekend 2014. thx! for sharing people. Sparkling apple cider look, light golden, creamy white head. Very clear woody Boon funk in the nose, bitter peel, light esters, lots of bitter wood in the nose, Bitter wood, green apple, touch watery, light cider, bitter ester, lots of Boon wood in here, touch soap,.. Softer carb, touch watery, Lacks in complexity, nowhere near for instance Vat 44. Decent but not very developed. Still a nice beer, just pales when compared to other geuzes.

@ beerweekend de lambiekstoempers 
Pours clear blonde , ok white head . 
Smell is funky , sharp , sour , wood . 
Boon , but in a very balanced and nice way . 
Ok carbo 
Taste is dry , tad sweet ( as most boon-beers ) very typical . Bit nitter , ok , not too different though in a blind tasting it would be hard to pick this out of his other geuzes ..
